required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reactogenicity and Protectivity Following Measles- Rubella (MR) Routine Immunization in Indonesian Infants and Children
clinical_study.official_title: Reactogenicity and Protectivity Following Measles- Rubella (MR) Routine Immunization in Indonesian Infants and Children

brief_summary.textblock: to assess safety and immunogenicity of measles-rubella (MR) routine immunization in Indonesian Children and Infants

detailed_description.textblock:
- to asses serious immediate systemic events,
- to assess local and systemic reaction after Measles-Rubella (MR) vaccine in infants and children,
- to evaluate protectivity and antibody response to measles and rubella after 1 dose of MR vaccine

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Safety Group: open labeled, prospective intervention study, only assess the safety outcome Sub Group: open labeled, prospective intervention study, evaluate safety and protectivity outcome
study_design_info.masking_description: laboratory analyst are masked for the evaluation of antibody against measles and rubella. The immunogenicity is measured before and after vaccination.

primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with at least one serious immediate systemic events within 30 minutes after vaccination
Percentage of subjects with at least one serious immediate systemic events within 30 minutes after vaccination

secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with at least one local reaction occurring within 72 h after vaccination.
Number of subjects with at least one systemic event occurring within 72 h after vaccination.
Number of subjects with at least one local reaction occurring between day 4-14 after vaccination.
Number of subjects with at least one systemic event occurring between day 4-14 after vaccination.
-Number of subjects with at least one systemic event occurring between day 15 to 28 following vaccination.
Number of subjects with at least one systemic event occurring between day 15 to 28 following vaccination.
- Number of serious adverse event occuring from inclusion until 28 days after immunization

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity for Measles (subject with anti measles titer ≥ 8 (1/dil))
secondary_outcome.description: - Percentage of subjects with anti measles titer ≥ 8 (1/dil), 28 days after one dose of MR vaccine in Infants & Children.
- Geometric Mean Titer of measles antibody

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity for Measles (increasing measles antibody titer ≥ 4 times)
secondary_outcome.description: - Percentage of infants with increasing measles antibody titer ≥ 4 times

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity for Measles (seroconversion from seronegative to seropositive)
secondary_outcome.description: - Percentage of infants with transition of seronegative to seropositive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity for Rubella (Subjects with anti rubella titer ≥11 IU/ml)
secondary_outcome.description: - Percentage of subjects with anti rubella titer ≥11 IU/ml, 28 days after one dose of MR vaccine in Infants & Children.
- Geometric Mean Titer of Rubella antibody.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity for Rubella (increasing rubella antibody titer ≥ 4 times)
secondary_outcome.description: - Percentage of infants with increasing rubella antibody titer ≥ 4 times

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity for Rubella (seroconversion from seronegative to seropositive)
secondary_outcome.description: - Percentage of infants with transition of seronegative to seropositive.

arm_group.description: open labeled, prospective intervention study, only assess the safety outcome. The Measles-Rubella vaccine is administered in infants age 9-12 months or 18 - 47 months. This study group only assessed for safety profile of the Measles-Rubella vaccine.

open labeled, prospective intervention study, assess the safety and immunogenicity outcome. The Measles-Rubella vaccine is administered in infants age 9-12 months or 18 - 47 months. For Sub study, pre- and post immunization sera will be obtained from 200 infants and/or children. Safety assessment also evaluated for 28 days after immunization.

intervention.description: Measles and Rubella Vaccine, live attenuated (Serum Institute of India) Form : Freeze dried Dose : 1 dose 0.5 ml contains not less than 1000 CCID50 of measles virus and 1000 CCID50 of rubella virus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy infants (9-12 months) or children (18-47 months)
- Will receive MR routine immunization.
- Parents have been informed properly regarding the study and signed the informed consent form.
- Parents will commit themselves to comply with the instructions of the investigator and the schedule of the trial.
Exclusion Criteria:
- MR vaccine given simultaneously with other vaccination, except Pentabio (DTP/HB/Hib)

overall_official.affiliation: Child Health Dept. Dr. Soetomo Hospital/School of Medicine, Airlangga Univ.

facility.name: Child Health Dept. Dr. Soetomo Hospital, School of Medicine Airlangga Univ.
